Each situation will be considered on an individual, case-by-case basis, with attention being given to the nature and seriousness of the crime, the time elapsed from the conviction date, circumstances, job description, and job location. 
(E)  Physical examinations. 
A pre-employment medical examination and drug screen is required. The selected candidate will be directed to Civil Service to be referred for a physical examination. No candidate will be put on the payroll until after he/she has completed and passed the physical exam and drug screen. 
(Ord. 31209-12, passed 11-28-12)

CHAPTER 41. - DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS 

Sec. 41.01. - Department of Public Works created. 
(A)  The Department of Public Works is hereby created and established, which Department shall be organized into an Office of the Director and the following divisions: 
(1)  Division of Civil Engineering. 
(2)  Division of Fleet Management. 
(3)  Division of Street Maintenance. 
(4)  Division of Waste Collection. 
(5)  Division of Property Management. 
(B)  The Office of the Director shall be in the charge of the Director, who shall be responsible for and in overall charge of the Department and all of its functions, and who shall also have the powers and duties as provided by the Charter, the ordinances of the City of Dayton, and other applicable statutes and laws, but subject to the management and control of the City Manager in all matters. The Office of the Director shall perform the following duties and functions: 
(1)  Provide fiscal and operational planning and other administrative support functions for the Department of Public Works as determined by the Director. 
(2)  Perform such other duties and exercise such other powers as assigned to the Director of Public Works by the Charter and ordinances of the city, and other applicable statutes and laws. 
(3)  Oversee the management, maintenance and disposition of the city's real estate and facilities, and the disposition of the city's personal property, except such functions that have been, by ordinance, specifically assigned to another Department. 
(C)  Division of Civil Engineering. 
(1)  This Division shall be responsible for managing the construction and improvements of streets, sidewalks, alleys, bridges, viaducts, boulevards, squares, and other public highways, places, grounds and buildings belonging to the city; managing the construction and maintenance of the city-owned electrical services, communication cable and traffic signals; construction and improvement of sewers, drains, ditches, culverts, canals, streams, and watercourses; and the making and preserving of all surveys, maps, plans, drawings, and estimates for such public work. 
(2)  This Division shall also provide technical services in the field of traffic planning, analysis and research. 
(D)  Division of Fleet Management. This Division shall be responsible for the repair, service, maintenance and licensing of the city's motorized fleet, as assigned by the City Manager, and may make recommendations regarding the acquisition, replacement and disposition of such equipment. 
(E)  Division of Street Maintenance. This Division shall be responsible for the repair and maintenance of streets, alleys, lanes, bridges, viaducts, boulevards, squares, city park and recreation facilities, playgrounds, ballparks, and specialized facilities and other public highways, places and grounds belonging to the city, except those on the grounds operated by the Departments of Aviation and Water; and arboriculture, ornamental horticulture, urban forestry and the maintenance and mowing of nuisance vacant lots and vacant structures within the City of Dayton. 
(F)  Division of Waste Collection. This Division shall be responsible for the collection and disposal of wastes and promotion of recycling, reduction and reuse activities. 
(G)  Division of Property Management. This Division shall be responsible for the collection and disposal of wastes and promotion of recycling, reduction and reuse activities. 
(H)  Where necessary for the efficient operations of the Department of Public Works, the Director may reassign or expand the functions of the various divisions, with the advice and consent of the City Manager. 
(I)  The Director, the Deputy Director and the heads of the Divisions above, shall serve at the pleasure of the City Manager. 
(Ord. 21987, passed 3-16-66; Am. Ord. 25024, passed 12-17-75; Am. Ord. 26733, passed 2-23-83; Am. Ord. 26948, passed 2-22-84; Am. Ord. 27723, passed 3-30-88; Am. Ord. 28775-94, passed 1-5-94; Am. Ord. 29050-95, passed 8-2-95; Am. Ord. 29320-96, passed 12-31-96; Am. Ord. 29455-97, passed 9-3-97; Am. Ord. 30198-02, passed 12-23-02, passed 12-23-02; Am. Ord. 30428-05, passed 2-23-05; Am. Ord. 31130-11, passed 12-21-11; Am. Ord. 31620-18, passed 2-7-18) 
Sec. 41.02. - City parks. 
    It shall be the duty of the Director of Public Works, and he shall have the power, subject to the approval of the City Commission, to make rules and regulations for the management, maintenance, and operation of city park facilities. The rules and regulations shall be in force and effect immediately upon being approved by the Commission, which approval shall be made by motion and shall be entered upon the minutes of the Commission. 
    Operating hours at city parks shall be set by the Director of Public Works in published rules and regulations. The hours of operation shall be posted at all entrances to city parks or in a conspicuous location in each park. In the absence of a published or posted set of operating hours, the operating hours for any city park shall be between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and sunset. 
(Ord. 31130-11, passed 12-21-11) 
CHAPTER 42. - DEPARTMENT OF BUILDING SERVICES 

Sec. 42.01. - Department of Building Services. 
(A)  A Department of Building Services is established. The Department of Building Services consists of a Director and such other officers and employees as appointed by the City Manager. The Director shall manage and assign the work of the Department of Building Services, subject to the supervision and control of the City Manager. 
(B)  The Department of Building Services is divided into the following divisions: 
(1)  Housing Inspection Division; 
(2)  Building Inspection Division; and 
(3)  Zoning Administration Division. 
(C)  The Department of Building Services and its divisions shall regulate land use, commercial and residential construction, housing code enforcement and nuisance abatement through the administration of various codes and ordinances. and perform such other duties as required by the Charter and ordinances of the city. 
(Ord. 28059, passed 1-24-90; Am. Ord. 29044-95, passed 8-2-95; Am. Ord. 29615-98, passed 9-30-98; Am. Ord. 30683-07, passed 9-12-07; Am. Ord. 31304-14, passed 4-23-14) 
Sec. 42.02. - Assignment of duties and responsibilities. 
(A)  Any reference in the building and zoning codes to the Superintendent of Inspectional Services and/or the Superintendent of Business Services, insofar as they relate to the construction, authorization, or repair of buildings or other structures, shall be applicable instead to the head of the Building Inspection Division. 
(B)  All references to the Division of Building Inspection, as previously constituted and/or the division of business services, the Department of Urban Development, or the Director of the Department of Urban Development, insofar as they relate to licenses and permits, shall be applicable instead to the Division of Building Inspection, the Department of Building Services, or the Director of Building Services, respectively. 
(Ord. 29077-95, passed 8-30-95; Am. Ord. 29615-98, passed 9-30-98) 
Sec. 42.03. - Conservation Specialists. 
(A)  Notwithstanding any other provision of the Revised Code of General Ordinances to the contrary, and to the extent authorized by § 150.423, Conservation Specialists, and/or housing inspectors, and/or any other employee who may be designated by the Director may perform, inter alia and without limitation, all of the functions of housing and/or zoning code enforcement, and shall also be deemed to be authorized agents of the Zoning Administrator, who is defined elsewhere in this Code. 
(B)  Conservation Specialists are authorized to perform, inter alia and without limitation, all of the functions necessary to the enforcement of the Refuse Code, as found in chapter 51; the Abandoned or Junk or Inoperable Vehicles Code, as found in chapter 76; the Fire Prevention Code, as found in chapter 92, but only to the extent authorized in § 92.120; the Housing Code, as found in chapter 93; the Nuisance, Trees And Trash Code, as found in chapter 96; the Nonresidential Building Maintenance Code, as found in chapter 99; the Zoning Code, as found in chapter 150, but only to the extent authorized by § 150.423; and the Public Nuisances Code, as found in chapter 152, of the Revised Code of General Ordinances. To that extent, this section shall be construed to confer upon conservation specialists the fullest authority possible to do all things necessary and proper to enforce every provision of the above referenced codes, regardless of whether or not the offense alleged is punishable by incarceration. Moreover, this section shall be construed to confer such authority on conservation specialists regarding all legal notices of violations, regardless of whether they were issued either prior or subsequent to the effective date of this section, and regarding all citation tags and/or court complaints, regardless of whether they were issued either prior or subsequent to the effectiveness date of this section. 
(Ord. 31136-11, passed 12-21-11) 
Sec. 42.04. - Reserved. 
Sec. 42.05. - Small Business Development Advisory Council. 
    The Small Business Development Advisory Council is hereby created to serve in an advisory capacity to the Division of Business Services. 
(A)  Membership on the Council shall be open to anyone interested in serving. The City Manager or the City Manager's designee shall prepare a list of representative organizations from which persons shall be appointed by the City Commission to serve on the Council. Members appointed by the City Commission to the Council need not be residents of the city. The term of office shall be three years. Members of the Council shall serve without compensation. 
(B)  The City Manager or the City Manager's designee shall meet with and serve as an advisory member of the Council. The term of the Council shall be contemporaneous with the City Manager's tenure. 
(C)  The members on the Council shall be subject to removal from office by the City Commission with or without cause. Any vacancy on the Council shall be filled by appointment by the City Commission for the unexpired term. 
(D)  The Council shall serve in an advisory capacity, assist with the development of proposals to improve customer service within the division of business services, make recommendations to the city with respect to improving the delivery of service to users, and perform such other duties as may be requested by the City Commission. 
(Ord. 28059, passed 1-24-90)

(G)  Unless expressly provided otherwise, the duties and responsibilities assigned by ordinance to the Director of the Department of Community Development or the Department of Community Development are transferred to the as the Director of the Department of Planning and Community Development or the Department of Planning and Community Development, as appropriate.
