If the Director of Building Services finds such plumbing to be contrary to the laws of the state and the ordinances of the city, relative to sanitation and plumbing, and the person responsible for such violations of law refuses to rectify the conditions complained of, the Director is authorized to refuse a permit for further work until the owner, director, or supervisor of the utility, institution, building, or plant requires the person engaged in such work to obtain registrations as provided by these sections. 
(2)  Departments, branches, service units, or buildings of the federal, state, county, and city. 
(3)  An individual performing plumbing work in accordance with the requirements of the laws of the state and the ordinances of the city for his or her own use on premises owned and occupied by him or her as a single-family residence or being built by him or her for his or her personal occupancy as a single-family residence shall be granted a permit for such work by the Director of Building Services upon making an affidavit that such work is not for hire, and is in or on premises so used and occupied or to be so used and occupied as aforesaid. This permit shall be conditioned upon the approval of such work, at its completion, by the Department of Building Services. 
(B)  Nothing herein shall be construed as a waiver of the provisions of the building code or other ordinances applicable to the installation, repair, or maintenance of plumbing or any other part of any building or structure. 
(Ord. 13434, passed 11-30-27; Am. Ord. 22164, passed 7-27-66; Am. Ord. 25735, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.20. - Connivance to violate §§ 114.01 through 114.20 prohibited. 
    No design professional, builder, contractor, corporation, firm, or individual shall knowingly aid or abet any plumber to do plumbing, gas fittings, or drain laying in violation of the provisions of §§ 114.01 through 114.20, or to connive at the violation thereof, or shall knowingly employ unregistered plumbers or uncertified apprentices, or shall knowingly permit their employment for the use of such architect, builder, contractor, corporation, firm, or individual. 
(Ord. 13434, passed 11-30-27; Am. Ord. 22164, passed 7-27-66; Am. Ord. 25735, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 114.99. 
Secs. 114.21-114.29. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - HEATING 

Sec. 114.30. - Definitions. 
    For the purposes of §§ 114.30 through 114.49 the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning: 
    Air conditioning system. The condenser, cooling coil, ducting, piping, controls, and devices necessary for operation. 
    Air handling system. A ducted system, with blower or blowers, filters, controls, dampers, and heating or cooling coils or both, with or without humidity controls. Automatic or mechanically operated coal stoker, conversion burner, thermostat, or internal or external blower equipment. Any equipment which is operated in whole or in part by any mechanical device taking the place of any manual operation. 
    Boiler system, steam and/or water. A boiler, the piping, radiation, circulating pump, condenser pump, feed water tank, cushion or expansion tank, and controls and devices necessary for operation. 
    Firm or corporation. A partnership, corporation, association, or other organization which contracts for, proceeds with, or employs others to perform the services of a warm air heating contractor. The members and officers of such organization may or may not have obtained individual registrations pursuant to §§ 114.30 through 114.49. However, no registration shall be issued to any such person, firm, or corporation until at least one of its members, officers, agents, or employees shall have passed the examination from the Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board and show proof of current Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board Specialty License, and agrees to stand back of and be responsible for all of the work performed by such firm or corporation. 
    Forced or mechanical warm air heating system. A warm air furnace, with casing, one or more motor-driven centrifugal type blowers, smoke or vent pipes, individual leader pipes or truck line systems with necessary control dampers for supply and return air, registers, faces, and grills; and with provisions for other appurtenances such as filters, air washers, ozonators, and humidifiers, as may be desired; including automatic controls for any or all apparatus installed. 
    Gravity warm air heating system. A furnace, with casing and smoke pipe, together with a properly designed system of heating pipes and outlets, known as registers; including air ducts to convey the return air to the furnace. 
    Heat pump system. An air conditioning system with heating being produced by a reversal of the cooling cycle, including usage of well water, lake water, or other heating medium, with provisions for supplementary heating, such as electric strip, gas burner, or oil burner for use below design temperatures. 
    Mechanical system. Any heating system; warm air furnace; air conditioning (other than a portable window unit); air handling; heat pump system; forced, gravity, or mechanical warm air heating system; boiler, steam, or hot water system; solar system; automatic, mechanical, or manually operated coal stoker; any type of conversion burner; thermostat; internal or external blower equipment in or to any warm air heating system, except kitchen ranges. 
    Solar system. Any such system, whether employing gravity, forced air, water, or other collector media. 
    Warm air heating contractor. Any person, firm, corporation, or other business entity engaged in the business of installing, repairing, altering, cleaning, or adding to one or more mechanical systems for the purpose of furnishing heating and/or cooling within the corporate limits of the city. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 16226, passed 6-11-47; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.31. - Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors created. 
    There is created a Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 17295, passed 1-23-52; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.32. - Membership of board. 
    The Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors shall consist of the Director of Building Services, the Chief Building Inspector, the Chief Fire Inspector in charge of Fire Prevention, and a Heating Inspector, or their duly authorized representatives, and three registered warm air heating contractors. The three registered warm air heating contractors shall be appointed annually by the City Manager for a term of one year, taking office on the board on July 1 of each year. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 17295, passed 1-23-52; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.33. - Officers of board. 
    The Director of Economic Development shall be president of the board and the board shall annually select a secretary, either from its own membership, in which case the secretary shall exercise full power of membership, or from without its membership. The secretary shall perform the usual duties of such office, acting as a general secretary and recording secretary, keeping all records of the board as hereinafter provided. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 17295, passed 1-23-52; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95) 
Sec. 114.34. - Oath of office. 
    Before assuming office, each member of the board shall take an oath before the Clerk of the Commission to properly perform the duties of his office as a member of the board. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 17295, passed 1-23-52; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95) 
Sec. 114.35. - Rules and regulations of board. 
(A)  The Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors shall make such rules and prescribe such procedure as may be necessary for its operation in conformity with §§ 114.30 through 114.49. Four members of the board shall concur its decisions. The Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board shall administer examinations for warm air heating contractor's licenses. 
(B)  The Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors shall keep accurate minutes of all its meetings, and keep such other records as may be required hereinafter. It shall make a complete annual written report to the City Manager each year. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.36. - Warm air heating contractor registration required. 
    All warm air heating contractors shall be required to secure a registration before engaging in such work. A permit for such work shall also be required, which shall not be issued by the Department of Building Services to any person, firm, corporation, or business organization unless the provisions of §§ 114.30 through 114.49 have been fully complied with by the applicant. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 21811, passed 10-6-65; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 114.99. 
Sec. 114.37. - Firm or corporation registration. 
    A registration issued to a firm or corporation shall allow such firm or corporation to engage in said business for such portion of the term of the registration as the particular member or members, officer or officers, agent or employee who has passed the examination pursuant to which said registration is granted, maintains his connection with the firm or corporation and agrees to stand back of and be responsible for all of the work performed by the firm or corporation. However, on the termination of his connection with the firm or corporation, the registration may be restored to effectiveness by the qualification of any of its other members or officers who may have successfully passed the examination administered by the Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board or by the employment by the firm or corporation of other agents or employees who have qualified by passing the examination and received the specialty license and who will agree to stand back of and be responsible for all work performed by said firm or corporation. No part of any fee shall be refunded for any cause. No registration may be used by a registrant for more than one firm, corporation, or business organization during the period for which such registration has been issued unless approval to do so is first obtained from the Board of Examiners for Warm Air Heating Contractors. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 24212, passed 3-1-72; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.38. - Application for registration. 
(A)  All applications for examinations to obtain a warm air heating contractor's registration shall be made upon blank forms furnished for such purpose by the Department of Building Services. 
(B)  Any person applying for a registration under the provisions of §§ 114.30 through 114.49 shall show proof of a valid and expired heating contractor's specialty license issued pursuant to Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 21811, passed 10-6-65; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.39. - Reserved. 
Sec. 114.40. - Insurance required of registrant. 
(A)  On each renewal or issuance of a warm air heating contractor's registration as required by §§ 114.31 through 114.49, the registrant who engages in the business of warm air heating as defined in § 114.30 shall furnish evidence to the Secretary of the Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors that the registrant has in full force and effect insurance coverage containing the following minimum amounts: 
Public liability: 
$100,000.00-each person 
$300,000.00-each accident 
$300,000.00-completed operation 
Property damage: 
$50,000.00-each accident 
$100,000.00-aggregate for operations liability 
$100,000.00-Aggregate for completed operations liability 
(B)  Such insurance shall protect people and/or property against loss arising out of any negligent act of the insured or any of his agents or employees, and shall contain an endorsement that the same shall not be cancelled before giving the city ten days' notice prior to cancellation. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 24212, passed 3-l-72; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 114.99. 
Sec. 114.401. - Bond required. 
    No person, firm, or corporation shall engage in business as a warm air heating contractor without first having filed with the Chief Building Official a good and sufficient surety bond to the city as obligee, in the principal sum of $10,000.00 by a surety company licensed by the state. The bond shall be approved by the City Accountant and conditioned upon the faithful observance of all ordinances of the city relating to such business. 
(Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95) 
Sec. 114.41. - Registration fees. 
    Warm Air Heating Contractor. The fee for a warm air heating contractor's registration shall be $400.00 biennially, effective from January 1 through December 31 of the succeeding year. If the registration is for a period of one year or less, the fee shall be $250.00. No part of any fee shall be refunded for any cause. 
(Ord. 19997, passed 7-5-61; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.411. - Registration issuance. 
    Upon payment of the registration fee as prescribed in § 114.41 and determination that, the applicant meets the requirements of §§ 114.36 through 114.40, a warm air heating contractor's registration shall be issued. 
(Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.42. - Registration renewal. 
    A warm air heating contractor's registration shall be renewed biennially, on January 1, at the fee as established in § 114.41. A warm air heating contractor's registration may be renewed annually, on January 1, for $250.00, effective from January 1 through December 31. 
(Ord. 13434, passed 11-30-27; Am. Ord. 22164, passed 7-27-66; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.43. - Examination required for renewal of expired registration. 
    Any warm air heating contractor who shall fail to obtain a renewal of registration as herein provided within 30 days from the date of its expiration, or such further time as the Board shall fix, shall, before he or she is issued such registration, be required to show proof of current heating contractor's specialty license issued pursuant to Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code, with payment of the fee and completed application therefor as in the original instance. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.44. - Registration nontransferable. 
    No registration issued under §§ 114.30 through 114.49 shall be transferable. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 21811, passed 10-6-65; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.45. - Disposition of registration. 
    All registrations required by §§ 114.30 through 114.49 shall be issued by the Department of Building Services, and all money derived from registration fees herein provided for shall be paid into the city treasury and be credited to the general fund. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.46. - Compliance with building code. 
    In addition to the requirements and provisions contained in the building code of the city, mechanical systems hereafter installed, altered, repaired, or added to shall be installed, altered, repaired, or added to in strict accord with the requirements and provisions of the building code regulating the installation of all mechanical systems approved and issued by authority of the National Warm Air Heating Association, Inc., the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air Conditioning Engineers, and the Sheet Metal and Air Conditioning Contractors National Association, Inc., as these codes now exist or may be amended hereafter, insofar as said requirements and provisions are not in conflict with the building code of the city. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 114.99. 
Sec. 114.47. - Revocation or suspension of registration; notice; hearing. 
(A)  The Board of Examiners of Warm Air Heating Contractors shall have the power to revoke or suspend all registrations issued under §§ 114.30 through 114.49. A registration shall be revoked immediately by the board upon conviction of the holder thereof, in a court of competent jurisdiction, of a violation of the laws of the state or of the ordinances of the city relative to warm air heating contractors. 
(B)  A registration issued pursuant hereto may also be revoked or suspended by the board in its discretion, when it finds that the registrant is guilty of fraudulent use of his registration, of incompetence in the exercise of the privileges of such registration, of fraud or misrepresentation in securing the registration or permits granted by virtue thereof; or of refusal to conform his or her work to the requirements of law; or of such other breaches of duty, as registrant or apprentice, as the Board may regard contrary to the intent and purposes of these sections. 
(C)  In all cases involving revocation or suspension of a registration, at least 15 days' notice of the contemplated revocation or suspension shall be served upon the registrant whose registration is in question; such notice shall be in the form of a summons, as provided by the laws of Ohio in civil actions, and shall be served in the manner provided by such laws for the service of summons. It shall indicate the time and place of the hearing and the general grounds of the contemplated revocation or suspension, and shall advise the registrant of his right to appear at such hearing in person and by counsel for the purpose of presenting his defense therein. The registrant shall have the right to interrogate witnesses at the hearing and be heard orally upon the merits of his defense. The board shall have the power to subpoena and compel attendance of witnesses, to administer oaths, to punish for contempt, compel the production of records and other documentary evidence, and to do all lawful things essential to a full hearing of the case before it. It shall make a complete record of such cases, and may at its discretion keep a stenographic record of the testimony produced in such hearings. It may request legal advice from the law department, and may adopt such procedure for its decorum and the dispatch of business at such hearings as it may regard advisable. The decision of the board shall be final, and no registrant whose registration has been revoked or suspended shall be granted a new registration until the expiration of six months after such revocation or suspension and after successful examination and payment of all fees as in the original instance. A revocation or suspension of registration shall not entitle a registrant to a refund of any part of the registration fee which he may have paid. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 16226, passed 6-11-47; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.48. - Nonapplicability of §§ 114.30 through 114.49. 
(A)  The provisions of §§ 114.30 through 114.49 shall not apply to: 
(1)  Public utilities, public institutions, public buildings, or mercantile, commercial, or industrial plants which maintain departments for the installation and maintenance of any mechanical system in or on their premises under expert supervision and in conformity with the laws of the state and the ordinances of the city relative to such installations and maintenance. If the Director of Building Services finds any such mechanical system to be installed, repaired, or altered contrary to the laws of the state or ordinances of the city, and the person responsible for such violation refuses to rectify the conditions complained of, the Director is authorized to refuse a permit for further work until the owner, director, or supervisor of such establishment requires the persons engaged in such work to obtain a registration as provided by these sections. 
(2)  Departments, branches, service units, or buildings of federal, state, or municipal governments. 
(3)  An individual installing, repairing, altering, cleaning, or adding to a mechanical system in accord with the requirements of the laws of the state and the ordinances of the city, for his or her own use, in a single family structure owned and occupied by him or her or being built by him or her for his personal occupancy. Such persons shall be granted a permit for such work by the Director of Building Services upon signing an affidavit that such work is not for hire and is in or on premises so used and occupied as a single-family residence, or to be so used and occupied; such permit shall be conditioned upon the approval of such work at its completion by the Department of Building Services. 
(B)  Nothing herein shall be construed as a waiver of the provisions of the building code or other ordinances applicable to the installation, repair, or maintenance of any mechanical system, or any part of any building or structure; provided, further, that this chapter shall not prevent a plumbing contractor duly registered by the city, to obtain necessary permits and install steam or hot water boiler systems, unit heaters, infrared heaters, room heaters, wall furnaces or conversion burners. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 16226, passed 6-11-47; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Sec. 114.49. - Connivance to violate §§ 114.30 through 114.49 prohibited. 
    No design professional, builder, contractor, corporation, firm, or individual shall knowingly aid or abet any warm air heating contractor to do any work in violation of the provisions of §§ 114.30 through 114.49 or to connive at its violation, or shall knowingly employ unregistered warm air heating contractors for the performance of such work. 
(Ord. 14813, passed 6-19-35; Am. Ord. 25736, passed 4-18-79; Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95; Am. Ord. 30057-01, passed 12-26-01) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 114.99. 
Secs. 114.50-114.98. - Reserved. 
Sec. 114.99. - Penalty. 
    Any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree. 
(Am. Ord. 29118-95, passed 11-22-95) 
CHAPTER 115. - PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION 
DIVISION 1. - RAILROADS 

Sec. 115.01. - Railroad flagman required. 
    At all street crossings at grade where automatic flasher lights have not been installed and where occasional switching is done, the railroad company before moving any cars, engine, or train across the crossing shall stop the cars, engine, or train before reaching the streets or any of them and then proceed. However, this section shall not be interpreted so as to necessitate the stopping of any through train at such crossing. 
(Ord. 16715, passed 6-22-49; Am. Ord. 20999, passed 12-11-63; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.02. - Railroad crossing repairs. 
    Whenever in the opinion of the Director of Public Works the surface of any crossing maintained by a railroad over a street or alley in the city is in need of repair or improvement, the director shall notify in writing the local managing agent or any ticket or freight agent of the railroad company maintaining the crossing, to make the necessary repairs. If the repairs are not made within 15 days after the giving of notice, the city shall have the right to make the repairs and charge to and collect from the railroad company the entire cost and expense of such repairs or improvement. 
(Ord. 13959, passed 5-15-29) 
Sec. 115.03. - Obstruction of streets by railroad. 
    No person having charge of any railroad car, engine, or locomotive, or any railroad company in the city, shall obstruct, unnecessarily, any street in the city by permitting railroad car or locomotive to remain on or across it for longer than five minutes, or permit timber, lumber, wood, or other obstructions to remain on or across any street to the hindrance or inconvenience of travelers, or a person passing along or on such street. 
(Ord. 2 G.O. 97, passed 12-26-1879; Am. Ord. 16715, passed 6-22-49; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.04. - Running switches prohibited. 
    No person having the supervision or control of any railroad train, cars, or locomotive, or any person, assisting in the same, shall cause or allow to be made with such trains, cars, or locomotives, across any of the streets in this city, what is commonly called a "running switch". 
(Ord. 9393, passed 6-16-13) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.05. - Headlights. 
    Whenever cars or locomotives are operated on any railroad within the corporate limits of the city after dark, a light of sufficient brilliancy to notify persons of the approach of such cars or locomotives shall be placed and maintained upon the end of such locomotive, car, or cars facing toward the direction in which they are being run. 
(Ord. 4481, passed 2-11-96) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.06. - Boarding and leaving cars. 
    No person not employed by a railroad company, or not being a passenger going to or coming from any station outside the corporate limits of the city, shall get on or off, or attempt to get on or off, any railroad car or locomotive engine when the car or engine is in motion. 
(Ord. 2 G.O. 2, passed 1-23-1874) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.07. - Speed districts (trains). 
    There are created two districts within the city named the inner district and the outer district for train speed regulation purposes. 
(A)  The inner district shall be that portion of the central part of the city which lies within a circle described by a radius one mile in length having for its center the intersection of Third and Main Streets. The limits of the inner district are approximately marked out by the following railroad and street crossing locations: Keowee Street and the B & O Railroad; East First Street and the Con Rail/B & O, Fourth Street and the Con Rail Railroad; Washington Street and the B & O/Con Rail Railroads; Pease Street and the Con Rail Railroad; the Extension of Apple Street and the Con Rail Railroad. 
(B)  The outer district shall be all of the corporate territory of the city lying outside of the inner district. 
(Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Sec. 115.08. - Speed limits. 
    No person having the care, supervision, or control of any railroad train, car, cars, or locomotive shall run or permit to be run such train, car, cars, or locomotive within the limits of the inner district as defined and described in § 115.07 at a greater rate of speed than 25 miles per hour or within the outer district as defined in § 115.07 at a greater rate of speed than 40 miles per hour. 
(Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.09. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - MOTOR BUSES 
Subdivision (A). - General Provisions 

Sec. 115.10. - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of §§ 115.10 through 115.28 the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning: 
    Bus. Any vehicle having a seating capacity for at least nine passengers, engaged in the business of carrying passengers for hire in or within the city. 
    Established tariff charge. The charge set forth in the tariff as published and filed by the railroad, parlor or sleeping car owner or operator, air line or bus line involved. 
    Interurban passengers. Passengers whose point of origin or whose point of destination was outside the limits of the city. Passengers whose point of origin was within a municipality immediately adjacent to the city and whose destination was within the limits of the city and passengers whose point of origin was within the limits of the city and whose point of destination is within a municipality immediately adjacent to the city shall not be included within the meaning of such term. 
    In the city, within the city, and streets. Includes any of the streets, avenues, bridges, alleys, highways, courts, lanes, or public places within the corporate limits of the city. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Sec. 115.11. - Charges for procurement of travel tickets restricted. 
(A)  No person shall require, charge, make, or receive, within the corporate limits of the city, for the procurement on behalf of another, by purchase or otherwise, of any ticket, reservation, or passenger accommodation, issued by any railroad, parlor or sleeping car owner or operator, airline or bus line, a fee or service charge or any payment or consideration for rendering such service in excess of $1.00 for the first transportation ticket, reservation, or passenger accommodation or first parlor car or sleeping car reservation or passenger accommodation, or in excess of $1.00 for any additional transportation ticket or parlor car or sleeping car reservation or passenger accommodation over the established tariff charge or charges therefor. 
(B)  No person shall procure on behalf of another person, within the corporate limits of the city, by purchase or otherwise, any ticket, reservation or passenger accommodation, issued by any railroad, parlor or sleeping car owner or operator, airline or bus line, with the intent, with respect to such other person, to require, charge, make, or receive a service charge or any payment or consideration for rendering service in excess of the amount or amounts hereinabove specified in subsection (A) over the established tariff charge or charges therefor. Proof of the making of a service charge or of the receipt of any payment or consideration, in connection with the procurement of such ticket, reservation or passenger accommodation, for such other person, in excess of the amount or amounts hereinabove specified in subsection (A), over such established tariff charge or charges, shall be presumptive evidence of the intent to violate this section. 
(C)  No person shall sell, resell, or cause to be resold, within the corporate limits of the city, any ticket, reservation, or passenger accommodation, issued by any railroad, parlor or sleeping car owner or operator, air line or bus line, at a price in excess of the amount or amounts hereinabove specified in subsection (A) over the established tariff charge or charges therefor. 
(D)  No person shall procure, within the corporate limits of the city, by purchase or otherwise, any ticket, reservation, or passenger accommodation, issued by any railroad, parlor or sleeping car owner or operator, air line or bus line, with the intent to sell or resell the same, or cause the same to be sold or resold, at a price in excess of the amount or amounts hereinabove specified in subsection (A) over the established tariff charge or charges therefor. Proof of the sale or resale of such ticket, reservation or passenger accommodation or combination thereof at a price in excess of the amount or amounts hereinabove specified in subsection (A) over such established tariff charge or charges shall be presumptive evidence of the intent to violate this section. 
(E)  This section shall not apply to tickets, reservations, or passenger accommodations to or from places outside of the continental United States and Canada, excluding Alaska, nor to existing written contracts between any travel agency and corporations, firms, or government agencies covering tourist or travel services. 
(Ord. 15818, passed 2-16-44) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.12. - Spitting in public conveyances prohibited. 
    No person shall spit or expectorate in or upon any railroad, trolley, motor bus, motor-feeder bus, or taxicab operated within the city. 
(Ord. 4876, passed 12-10-1897; Am. Ord. 17106, passed 3-21-51) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.13. - Posting of notice required. 
    It shall be the duty of the operators to post notices in their railroad cars, trolleys, motor buses, motor-feeder buses, and taxicabs that it is unlawful to expectorate in or upon and out of those vehicles operated or run within the city. 
(Ord. 4876, passed 12-10-1897) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.14. - Smoking in public conveyances prohibited. 
    No person shall smoke tobacco in any form, or carry lighted or burning tobacco in any form, in or on a street car, trolley coach, interurban motor bus, urban motor bus, motor-feeder bus or school bus operated within the corporate limits of the city. 
(Ord. 15888, passed 2-7-45) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.15. - No smoking notice to be posted. 
    It shall be the duty of the person, firm, or corporation operating any car, coach, or bus within the corporate limits of the city to post a notice that it is unlawful to smoke in the cars, coaches, or buses so operated. 
(Ord. 15888, passed 2-7-45) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.16. - Offenses involving motor buses. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person, any driver of a bus, or any passenger thereon or for any bus licenses to do any one of the following: 
(A)  Drive or operate any such bus while any passenger or other person is standing on a running board, fender, mudguard, or other outside part of such vehicle. 
(B)  Operate a bus while any passenger or other person or thing obstructs in any manner the view of the driver thereof. 
(C)  Place or do anything so as to obstruct the view of the driver. 
(D)  Occupy or permit any person to occupy the driver's seat along with the driver. 
(E)  Hawk or call for passengers from the street or curb. Any solicitation for trade except by display of sign on the bus, is prohibited; and the starting of such buses on trips by calling, whistling, or the use of any noisemaking device is prohibited. 
(F)  Receive or discharge any passenger on a street at a place other than a regularly designated bus stop or school bus stop for such bus. 
(G)  For any bus licensee to fail to have posted at a conspicuous place at the place where fares or other compensation are received or where contracting for such service, a complete applicable schedule of all of such fares, fees, rates, and tariffs. 
(H)  For any bus licensee to charge a passenger more than the fare or other compensation which is posted at the place where fares or other compensation are received or where contracting for such service. 
(I)  For any bus licensee to charge a passenger more than the fares, fees, rates, and tariffs as contained in his application on which his license was granted, or as modified as provided in § 115.24. 
(J)  For any bus licensee to operate a bus within the city except in accordance with the information contained in the application on which his license was granted, or as modified as provided in § 115.24. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.17. - Refusal to carry passengers. 
    No regularly scheduled bus serving the general public shall refuse to carry any person or persons who properly apply for passage on such bus at a point at which the bus is authorized to receive passengers unless the same is loaded to capacity. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.18. - Enforcement of §§ 115.10 through 115.17. 
    It shall be the duty of the Department of Police to enforce the provisions of §§ 115.10 through 115.17. 
(Ord. 2 G.O. 97, passed 12-26-1879) 
Sec. 115.19. - Reserved. 
Subdivision (B). - Bus Licenses 

Sec. 115.20. - Compliance required. 
    No person shall operate or cause to be operated a bus in the city without first having obtained and having currently in effect, a license to so operate issued in compliance with the provisions of §§ 115.10 through 115.27. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.21. - Application for bus license. 
(A)  Application for bus license shall be made in writing to the Director of Finance and shall be accompanied by an application fee of $50.00, none of which shall be refunded if such application is denied. 
(B)  The application shall contain the name and address of the applicant, a statement of the legal entity of such applicant, and shall be signed by the applicant. 
(C)  The application shall contain full information concerning the physical equipment to be used by the applicant in providing any bus service. 
(D)  The application shall contain a full description of the type of service to be performed. If the service is to be a regularly scheduled service offered to the general public, the application shall contain a description showing the complete route indicating all streets over which the bus is to travel and an attached map showing the routes and streets, a complete schedule of operation of the bus, and location of all bus stops. 
(E)  The application shall contain a complete schedule of fares, rates, and tariffs to be charged in connection with the bus service. 
(F)  The application shall contain a statement stating the insurance coverage of the applicant covering the bus service. The applicant shall furnish to the city, a certificate of insurance issued by an insurance or liability company authorized to write this type of insurance in the state. The certificate shall contain a clause obligating the insurance carrier to give ten days; written notice to the Director of Finance prior to any cancellation of such policy. 
(G)  The application shall contain a statement stating whether or not the services, or similar services, are being provided by any other person and whether to the applicant's knowledge the services he proposes to provide would have any adverse effect or interference with the use of the streets by the general public. 
(H)  The application shall contain a statement stating whether this is an application for an original license or whether it is a renewal of an existing license; and if a renewal of an existing license, a statement of the changes, if any, proposed. 
(Ord. 17168, passed 6-6-51; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Sec. 115.22. - Recommendations required. 
    On receipt of a proper application for a bus license and the requisite fee, the Director of Finance shall refer the application to the Director of Public Works, to the Director of Urban Development, to the Director of Police, to the Department of Planning, and to any regional transit authority of which the city is a member, for comments and recommendations. Comments and recommendations shall not be required of the Department of Planning or of the regional transit authority. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Sec. 115.23. - Issuance of bus license. 
(A)  The Director of Finance shall issue a bus license upon determination that: 
(1)  The application meets all of the requirements of §§ 115.20 through 155.28; 
(2)  The insurance is in an amount sufficient to adequately protect the interests of the public having due regard for the number of persons and the amount of property that may be affected; 
(3)  The operation of the proposed bus service would not have any adverse effect or unreasonably interfere with the use of the streets by the general public; 
(4)  The proposed bus service would not duplicate or interfere with the service presently being provided by a regional transit authority of which the city is a member or with service which the regional transit authority proposed to furnish within the next 90 days. 
(B)  If the applicant fails to fulfill these requirements the Director of Finance shall refuse the issuance of the license and shall notify the applicant of such refusal together with the reason therefor. 
(Ord. 18518, passed 7-5-56; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Sec. 115.24. - Bus license. 
(A)  A bus license issued under §§ 115.10 through 115.28 shall permit the applicant to operate a bus within the city for a period of one year from the date of issuance thereof, in accordance with the information set forth in his application, on which the license was issued, unless sooner revoked by the Director of Finance. 
(B)  No person who has been issued a bus license under the provisions of §§ 115.10 through 115.28, shall alter the type of service furnished, the fees, fares, rates, and tariffs, the schedule of route or stops, the insurance provided or equipment used and maintenance thereof as set forth in the application on which the license was issued without first obtaining a new license as provided for in these sections, except that the Director of Finance may permit, on written notification of a substitution in buses and such insignificant changes which he determines do not materially alter the service being performed or the information set forth in the application on which the license was issued and a change in bus stop location but only after favorable recommendation of the Director of Public Works. The approval of the Director of Finance shall be in writing. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.25. - Revocation of license. 
(A)  Whenever any person holding a bus license issued under §§ 115.10 through 115.28, or a driver of any bus so licensed, shall be convicted of any violation of these sections, the Director of Finance is empowered and directed to revoke the license, and the revocation may be grounds to refuse the issuance of another license to the licensee within one year from the date of such revocation. 
(B)  The Director of Finance shall revoke any bus license whenever the director finds the licensee is not furnishing the service in accordance with the information contained in licensee's application upon which the license was issued or as modified as provided in § 115.24, or that any of the conditions contained in § 115.23 upon which the bus license was issued is no longer true. 
(C)  Revocation shall be by written notice to the licensee at the address provided in his application, and shall be effective upon the date specified in the notice. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Sec. 115.26. - Appeal. 
    An applicant shall have the right to appeal a refusal to grant a bus license or the revocation thereof to the City Commission by filing a written request with the Clerk of the Commission within ten days after the applicant was notified of such refusal or such revocation. Upon the filing of such a request the Clerk of the Commission shall within ten days forward the request together with all papers pertaining to the application for license or revocation thereof filed with the Director of Finance to the City Commission, together with a request that the City Commission set a hearing thereon and determine by motion whether the license should be granted or denied or whether the license should be revoked or not. The Clerk of the Commission shall give the applicant notice of this hearing. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Sec. 115.27. - Rules and procedures. 
    The Director of Finance with the approval of the City Manager is authorized to promulgate such procedures as he deems appropriate to accomplish the orderly application for, issuance and revocation of a bus license under §§ 115.10 through 115.28, and shall promulgate such requirements and regulations as may be appropriate, with the approval of the City Commission. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75) 
Sec. 115.28. - Exempted uses. 
(A)  Nothing in §§ 115.10 through 115.28 shall be construed to apply to buses operated by the United States Government. Nothing in §§ 115.10, 115.11, 115.17 through 115.28 shall be construed to apply to school buses operated by or for a public school district. 
(B)  Nothing in §§ 115.20 through 115.28 shall be construed to apply to buses operated by a regional transit authority of which the city is a member or to buses owned by another municipality and operated by its own employees, used exclusively for the transportation of passengers from a point of origin within that municipality to a point of destination within the limits of the city and from a point of origin within the limits of the city to a point of destination within the municipality except such municipality shall file the service and route information required by § 115.21(D) including any modifications, with the traffic engineer. 
(Ord. 11653, passed 7-12-22; Am. Ord. 24974, passed 9-10-75; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81) 
Sec. 115.29. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 3. - TAXICABS 

Sec. 115.30. - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of §§ 115.30 through 115.60, the following terms shall have the meaning herein set forth: 
(A)  "Taxicab" shall mean a vehicle operated for compensation, including donations, which receives passengers at a place within the city, to be driven to a destination either within or without the city, over any streets which may be available for such travel. "Taxicab" shall not include commercial quadricycles as defined in Ohio Revised Code Section 4301.62(F)(3). 
(B)  "Transportation network company" shall mean a company, including participating drivers, that uses an online-enabled platform to connect passengers with drivers, whether the service is referred to as ride-sharing, ride-booking, for-hire car service, or some other term. 
(C)  "In service" shall mean the driver of a transportation network company is available to respond to a request and/or responding to a request for transport from an online-enabled platform. 
(Ord. 12715, passed 12-30-25; Am. Ord. 22640, passed 8-30-67; Am. Ord. 26399, passed 12-9-81; Am. Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14; Am. Ord. 31511-16, passed 9-7-16; Am. Ord. 31549-17, passed 2-8-17) 
Sec. 115.301. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 31511-16, § 5, adopted September 7, 2016, repealed § 115.301, which pertained to transportation network company registration and derived from Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14. 
Sec. 115.302. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 31511-16, § 5, adopted September 7, 2016, repealed § 115.302, which pertained to transportation network company privilege fee and derived from Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14. 
Sec. 115.303. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 31511-16, § 5, adopted September 7, 2016, repealed § 115.303, which pertained to transportation network company participating drivers' registration tag, and derived from Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14. 
Sec. 115.31. - License required. 
(A)  No person shall drive a taxicab within the city without first obtaining and maintaining in full force and effect a valid taxicab independent operator and/or driver license issued by the city and a valid operator's license issued by the State of Ohio. 
(B)  No person shall manage or engage in the business of operating taxicabs within the city without first obtaining and maintaining in full force and effect a valid taxicab operator's license for each taxicab so operated. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.32. - Nonapplicability of §§ 115.30 through 115.60. 
(A)  No provision of §§ 115.30 through 115.60 shall apply to hotel buses or vans operating solely between James M. Cox Dayton International Airport and any hotel or motel, or to ambulances, funeral vehicles, or railroads or buses as defined in § 115.10, trucks or automobiles operated by any person for the transportation of employees, or to vehicles bringing passengers into the city from outside of the city. 
(B)  Sections 115.41(C), 115.44, 115.45, 115.47, 115.48, and 115.51 shall not apply to horse-drawn taxicabs. 
(C)  Sections 115.40(D), 115.44, 115.47, 115.48, 115.53, and 115.58 shall not apply to passenger shuttle services, as defined in § 37.06(D) of this Code. 
(D)  Sections 115.40(D), 115.41(C) and (D), 115.44, 115.45, 115.47, 115.48, 115.51, 115.53, and 115.58 shall not apply to chauffeured limousines as defined in R.C. § 4501.01(LL) and which are operated in compliance with all applicable provisions of state law, provided that the chauffeured limousine transportation is only furnished: 
(1)  Pursuant to a written agreement negotiated by the office of the provider of the chauffeured limousine and signed by the parties before the passenger boards; and 
(2)  That payment for the chauffeured limousine transportation is received at the office of the provider of the transportation pursuant to an invoice sent from that office. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 30068-02, passed 3-13-02; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.33. - Application for license. 
(A)  Every person desiring to drive a taxicab or to manage or engage in the business of operating taxicabs shall submit an application for the appropriate license to the Director of Police on a form provided for that purpose. The applicant shall answer all questions in the application. When an application for a taxicab operator's license is made on behalf of a corporation or partnership, the names and addresses of all officers or partners shall be included. The trade name under which the business will be operated shall also be stated. 
(B)  Upon receipt of the application, the Director of Police shall cause to be made such investigation of the applicant as is necessary to determine whether the applicant meets the requirements set forth in this division. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.34. - Requirements for taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license. 
    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license shall meet the following requirements: 
(A)  Be an American citizen, or a person who has been granted permanent residency by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration services, or have legal work authorization, and be able to speak and read the English language; 
(B)  Be 19 or more years of age. 
(C)  Be in sound physical condition, have good eyesight and not subject to any infirmity, defect, or disorder of mind or body which might reasonably render him or her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of driving a taxicab, as determined by the Director of Police from all reliable medical, psychological or health information supplied by the independent operator and/or driver or other persons concerning the independent operator and/or driver's physical or mental condition. The qualifications in this division shall be supported by the certificate of a physician licensed to practice in the State of Ohio. 
(D)  Possess a working knowledge of the traffic laws of the City of Dayton and State of Ohio. 
(E)  Possess a valid operator's license issued by the State of Ohio. 
(F)  Completion of annual mandatory training through the Dayton Police Department or other approved training by the Director of Police. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 30341-04, passed 3-31-04; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.341. - Dress code for taxicab independent operator and/or drivers. 
    The Taxicab License Appeals Board is authorized to develop and implement a minimum standard for hygiene and dress appearance of taxicab independent operator and/or drivers. Such minimum standards shall be required of all taxicab independent operator and/or drivers fourteen (14) days after publication of the adopted standards. 
(Ord. 28065, passed 2-14-90; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.35. - Requirements for taxicab operator's license. 
    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a taxicab operator's license shall meet the following requirements: 
(A)  Be an American citizen, or a person who has been granted permanent residency by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration services, or have legal work authorization, and be able to speak and read the English language; 
(B)  Be 21 or more years of age; 
(C)  Be able to provide the taxicab service required by § 115.44, and obtain the liability insurance required by § 115.46; 
(D)  Possess a working knowledge of the traffic laws of the City of Dayton and the State of Ohio. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.36. - Denial of license. 
(A)  A taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license or a taxicab operator's license shall not be issued to any person who: 
(1)  Has been convicted, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for any offense constituting a felony. 
(2)  Has been convicted, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for any offense involving the use, possession of, or sale of controlled substances. 
(3)  Has been adjudged mentally incompetent and has not been legally restored to competency. 
(4)  Is awaiting court action for any criminal offense. 
(5)  Is subject to any infirmity, defect, or disorder of mind or body which might reasonably render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of a taxicab independent operator and/or driver or a taxicab operator, as determined by the Director of Police from all reliable medical, psychological, or health information supplied by the applicant or other persons concerning the applicant's physical or mental condition. 
(6)  Has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of arrests that exhibits a disregard for the law. 
(7)  Within three years prior to filing the application for a license has been convicted of, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for three or more misdemeanor or felony offenses within a 12-month period of time, whether charged under state law or ordinances of any jurisdiction. 
(8)  Within three years prior to filing the application for a license has been convicted of, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for two or more misdemeanors involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency, or moral turpitude. 
(B)  If a license is denied or refused, the Director of Police shall cause written notification of such denial or refusal to be given to the applicant by certified mail at the address stated in the application, and said written notification shall include the basis for such denial or refusal, and shall advise the applicant of the procedure for appeal. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.361. - Taxicab License Appeals Board created; appeal procedure. 
(A)  A Taxicab License Appeals Board is created and shall consist of the Director of Finance, who shall be the Chairman, the Director of Police, the Director of Aviation, and the Director of Law, or their duly authorized representatives. A majority of the members of the Taxicab License Appeals Board shall constitute a quorum. 
(B)  A Taxicab License Appeals Board is created and shall consist of the Director of Finance, who shall be the Chairman, the Director of Police, the Director of Aviation, and the Director of Law, or their duly authorized representatives. A majority of the members of the Taxicab License Appeals Board shall constitute a quorum. 
(C)  Any applicant who has been denied or refused a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license or a taxicab operator's license may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the Taxicab License Appeals Board by submitting a written request for a hearing to the Director of Police within ten days after the service of the notice of denial or refusal. The written request for a hearing shall set forth the name, address, and telephone number of the applicant, and a brief statement of the grounds for appeal. This shall include the date of transmittal. Upon receipt of a request for a hearing the Director of Police shall deliver copies thereof to all members of the Taxicab License Appeals Board, and shall set a time and place for the hearing before the Taxicab License Appeals Board. The Director of Police shall give the applicant written notice of the hearing date by certified mail at least ten days prior to the date set for the hearing, which shall be commenced within 30 days after a request has been filed. 
(D)  At such hearing, the applicant shall be given an opportunity to be heard and to show cause why he/she believes the license should be issued. The Director of Police, or his designee shall also be given an opportunity to be heard and to state the reasons why he/she believes the license should not be issued. The failure of the applicant or his/her representative to appear and state their case at such hearing shall have the same effect as if no request for a hearing had been filed. 
(E)  After the hearing, the Taxicab License Appeals Board may, by a majority vote, sustain or deny the appeal, and the applicant shall be notified in writing of such decision and the reasons therefor. 
(F)  The proceedings at such hearings, including the decisions of the Taxicab License Appeals Board and the reasons for the decision, shall be summarized and reduced to writing and entered as a matter of public record in the office of the Director of Police. 
(G)  The Taxicab License Appeals Board shall meet from time to time, when it is deemed necessary by any member of the board, to review the administration and enforcement of the provisions of §§ 115.30 through 115.60, and for any other purpose related to the provisions of this division. 
(Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.37. - Suspension/revocation of license. 
(A)  The Director of Police shall have the right and authority to suspend or revoke, after notice and hearing, any taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license or taxicab operator's license issued under the provisions of §§ 115.30 through 115.60 whenever just cause exists. "Just cause" includes, but is not limited to, the following: 
(1)  The licensee has violated any of the provisions of §§ 115.30 through 115.59; 
(2)  The licensee's physical or mental condition becomes such as to render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of a taxicab independent operator and/or driver or taxicab operator, as determined by the Director of Police pursuant to the provisions of § 115.36(E); 
(3)  The licensee transports any person who, with the knowledge of such licensee, was at the time of such transportation engaged in any illegal activity; 
(4)  The licensee has intentionally given false answers to any questions on his/her application for such license; 
(5)  The licensee permits a taxicab to be operated for hire by a person not licensed as a taxicab independent operator and/or driver by the City of Dayton; 
(6)  The licensee has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of arrests that exhibits a disregard of the law; 
(7)  The licensee has been convicted of, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for three or more misdemeanor or felony offenses within a 12-month period of time; 
(8)  The licensee has been convicted of, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for two or more misdemeanors involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency, or moral turpitude within the last three years; 
(9)  The licensee fails to maintain all of the general qualifications applicable to the initial issuance of a license; 
(10)  The licensee has been convicted of, pled guilty to, or forfeited bond for any of the following offenses while operating a taxicab: 
(a)  Driving while under the influence of alcohol or any drug of abuse, or the combined influence of alcohol and any drug of abuse. 
(b)  Violation of the independent operator and/or driver's identification law. 
(c)  Vehicular homicide. 
(d)  Fleeing and eluding a police officer. 
(e)  Reckless operation. 
(f)  Leaving the scene of an accident. 
(g)  Any offense constituting a felony; 
(11)  The licensee has refused service to a passenger where a reasonable taxicab independent operator and/or driver would not have refused service; 
(12)  The licensee has failed to adhere to the dress code developed by the Taxicab Appeals Board; 
(13)  The licensee has failed to display his/her independent operator and/or driver identification; 
(14)  The licensee has overcharged the customer. 
(B)  After revocation of a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license or taxicab operator's license hereunder, no application for the same type of license shall be accepted or considered for a period of 12 months from the date of revocation. 
(C)  A taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license shall be deemed to be suspended or revoked upon the suspension, revocation, or expiration of the licensee's Ohio operator's license, during the term of such suspension, revocation, or expiration. 
(D)  In the event of a violation of any of the provisions in §§ 115.30 through 115.60, which results in any emergency situation in which continued operation by the taxicab independent operator and/or driver endangers the health, welfare, or safety of the public, the Director of Police may suspend any taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license hereunder; any such suspension may be made effective immediately and shall remain in force until a hearing is held. 
(E)  In addition to, and not as a substitute for the provisions in § 115.36 regarding written notification, procedure for appeal, and a hearing before the Taxicab License Appeals Board, when a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license has been suspended, and the suspension became effective immediately because of an emergency situation, the taxicab independent operator and/or driver may request, and shall be granted a hearing before the Director of Police or his designee, which shall be held within two business days after the suspension, at which time the taxicab independent operator and/or driver will be given the opportunity to show cause why the emergency suspension should be terminated and the license returned to the taxicab independent operator and/or driver. 
(F)  Except for the emergency suspension of a license under subsection (D) above, the provisions in § 115.36 regarding written notification, procedure for appeal, a hearing before the Taxicab License Appeals Board, and a decision rendered by said board, shall apply to any action taken by the Director of Police under this section. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.38. - Issuance of license; expiration. 
(A)  Upon approval of the application the Director of Police shall issue a license to the applicant authorizing that person to drive a taxicab or to engage in the business of operating a taxicab company, as the case may be. 
(B)  Taxicab operator's licenses issued to a corporation or a partnership shall be issued in the name of the corporation or partnership and the name of the operator or manager of the company. 
(C)  All licenses shall automatically renew each year in June, unless sooner revoked. The automatic renewal is subject to passage of the annual inspection and payment of annual licensing fees. 
(D)  All applications for renewal of licenses must be filed with the director of police between June 1 and June 30 of each year, and renewal licenses shall be issued in the same manner and upon the same conditions as prescribed herein for initial licenses. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.39. - Fee schedule. 
(A)  The application fee for a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license, and the annual renewal fees for a taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license shall be as follows: 
(1)  Initial application fee and license for remainder of license year in which application is first made: $25.00 (includes the cost of duplicate photographs to be taken by the Police Department). 
(2)  Annual renewal fee: $25.00 (includes the cost of duplicate photographs to be taken by the Police Department). 
(B)  The initial application fee for a taxicab operator's license for each taxicab, and the annual renewal fee for a taxicab operator's license for each taxicab shall be, as of July 1, 2000, $300.00. 
(C)  There shall be no reduction of any license fees regardless of when the application is filed, and no portion of those fees will be refunded if a license is not issued for any reason. 
(D)  Any person seeking to replace a current taxicab independent operator and/or driver's license, for any reason whatsoever, shall remit a $10.00 re-issuance fee. 
(E)  A $50.00 fee will be assessed to transfer a license from one taxicab to another during the license year. 
(F)  A $50.00 fee will be assessed to any payment against account(s) for which sufficient funds are not available to render complete and full payment, and the license will be automatically suspended until all fees are paid. 
(G)  All fees shall be payable into the city treasury and credited to the general fund. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 29812-00, passed 3-8-00; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Sec. 115.40. - Taxicab operator's license and registration tag. 
(A)  The taxicab operator's license issued by the Director of Police shall contain a statement of the number of cabs then used by the operator, the make and serial number of each cab, the registration number hereafter prescribed, and any other information regarded as necessary by the Director of Police. 
(B)  A taxicab operator's license may be transferred upon application filed with the Director of Police by the person, firm, or corporation to whom it is proposed to be transferred; provided, however, that such person, firm, or corporation shall meet and comply with all the requirements as set forth in §§ 115.30 through 115.60. 
(C)  The application shall be accompanied by a written statement from the person, firm, or corporation holding such license indicating their agreement to such transfer. 
(D)  The taxicab registration tag issued by the Director of Police shall be of metal, three inches by five inches in size. This tag shall be attached to the outside right front door of the cab, either to the rear of the upper hinge or below the body stripe. When the taxicab is horse-drawn, the tag shall be attached to the outside right front of the vehicle at any conspicuous place. Each tag shall contain one of a series of consecutive numbers to be known as taxi registration numbers, the expiration date, and such other information as the Director of Police may require. 
(E)  No taxicab operator or taxicab independent operator and/or driver shall operate or use any taxicab as such unless the said tag is affixed in the manner above provided, or operate or use any taxicab as such with any license tag other than the tag assigned to that taxicab. 
(F)  A registration tag may be transferred upon written request to the Director of Police by the taxicab operator holding the tag. 
(G)  The request shall contain the registration number of the tag proposed to be transferred and the serial number of the taxicab from which and to which the transfer is to be made. The written consent of the Director of Police to the transfer shall be endorsed upon the license of the taxicab operator and upon the records of the Police Department. 
(H)  No operator's license will be issued to a vehicle over eight years old. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.41. - Color scheme and insignia. 
(A)  No taxicab covered by the provisions of §§ 115.30 through 115.60 shall be licensed whose color scheme, or the name, monogram, or insignia to be used thereon is in conflict with, or, in the opinion of the Director of Police, imitates a color scheme, monogram, name, or insignia used by any other taxicab operator, or is such as to mislead or tend to deceive the public. 
(B)  After a license has been issued to a taxicab operator the color scheme, name, monogram, or insignia of the operator's taxicab shall not be changed without the prior written approval of the Director of Police. 
(C)  The full name, monogram, or insignia of the taxicab operator shall be conspicuously displayed on each side of each taxicab on the outside of either the front or the rear doors, or both, in letters at least two inches high or, in the case of a monogram or insignia, not less than eight inches high. 
(D)  Prior to the issuance of a taxicab operator's license, the operator shall present a photograph in color of the color scheme, monogram, or insignia of the operator to the Director of Police. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.42. - Sanitary condition of taxicabs required. 
(A)  Every taxicab shall at all times be kept in a clean and sanitary condition. 
(B)  A violation of this section, after reasonable notice to the operator and an opportunity duly afforded to comply therewith, shall be grounds for suspension or revocation of the taxicab operator's license. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.43. - Inspection of taxicabs. 
(A)  The Director of Police shall from time to time cause to be made an inspection of all taxicabs. If any taxicab shall be found to be unsafe or unfit for the transportation of passengers, or in an unclean or unsanitary condition, notice shall be given to the taxicab operator therefore, and no person shall operate that taxicab in taxicab service until it has been put in safe and fit condition and re-inspected and approved for use in such taxicab service. 
(B)  Any vehicle over eight years old will not pass inspection. 
(C)  All taxicabs must pass an inspection based on standards established by the Taxicab Appeals Board. The Taxicab Appeals Board shall approve the Taxicab Inspection Form utilized by the Dayton Police Department. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.44. - Hours and manner of operation. 
    All taxicab operators shall: 
(A)  Provide taxicab services 24 hours a day and seven days a week with the following exceptions: 
(1)  Sundays between the hours of 11:00 p.m. and 4:00 a.m. 
(2)  Smaller companies (having fewer than three vehicles) have the option of applying for a variance through the Director of Police, or his/her designee. 
(B)  Maintain a business office, which will be kept open to receive calls for service and dispatch taxicabs at all times of regular operations. The address of the business office shall be maintained on file with the Permit. Taxicab operators shall notify the Director of Police of any change in its business address within seven days of the change. 
(C)  Respond to all requests for service as soon as possible, and in the event that service cannot be furnished within a reasonable time, the operator shall inform the prospective passenger of the reason for the delay and provide the prospective passenger an estimated time of arrival for the service. 
(D)  Accepts request for service anywhere within the city when taxicabs are available for such service. Failure or refusal, except for conditions beyond the control of the operator, to furnish continuous service, shall be deemed a violation of this section, and the taxicab operator's license may be suspended or revoked pursuant to the provisions of § 115.37 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 30302-03, passed 1-15-03; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.45. - Daily call sheet or trip record required; names of taxicab independent operator and/or drivers. 
(A)  Every taxicab independent operator and/or driver shall keep an accurate daily call sheet or trip record containing a complete record of the operation of each cab driven by him/her each day and the fares charged, and turn this call sheet or trip record over to the taxicab operator at the end of his/her tour of duty. 
(B)  Every taxicab operator shall keep on file in the office thereof a call sheet or trip record containing a complete record of the daily operation of each licensed taxicab of the operator and make the record immediately available to and submit the same for inspection by the Department of Police within three days of a request. Such record shall be kept for a period of at least one year. 
(C)  Every taxicab operator shall furnish the Director of Police with the names of their taxicab independent operator and/or drivers, and shall furnish the names of new independent contractors and/or drivers, who terminate their employment within five days after a change occurs. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.46. - Insurance required. 
(A)  Every applicant for a taxicab operator's license shall, prior to operating any taxicabs, furnish proof of liability insurance coverage in such form as is satisfactory to the Director of Central Services, but not less than $1,000,000.00 for bodily injury and property damage. The policy shall remain in full force and effect during the entire licensure period. The city reserves the right to verify the accuracy and validity of any insurance certification furnished and the right to request additional certificates of insurance during the licensure term to ensure coverage continues, uninterrupted, and without lapse for the entire licensure term. 
(B)  The policy shall further provide that the insolvency or bankruptcy of the insured shall not release the insurance company from payment required to otherwise be made by the policy and, shall remain in full force and effect for the entire term of licensure, and available to any person damaged the same as though the licensee was not insolvent or bankrupt. 
(C)  The policy shall provide in addition to the aforesaid provisions, that no notice of any acts creating any liability thereunder will be required from the city; that the policy shall not be cancelled before ten days' written notice of intention so to cancel has been furnished to the City's Directors of Central Services and Police; and that the policy shall not be revocable, but shall remain in full force and effect until ten days have elapsed from the date of service of the written notice. 
(D)  The policy shall be renewed annually to the satisfaction of the Director of Central Services. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.47. - Taximeters required. 
(A)  No person shall operate or permit to be operated in the city any taxicab on a distance tariff or transport passengers in or offer for hire, unless that vehicle is equipped with a taximeter that has been approved by the Dayton Police Department. 
(B)  No person shall own, operate, or drive a taxicab unless such a taximeter is used in determining the fare to be charged, and no other or different fare shall be charged than what is recorded on the reading face of said taximeter for the trip, except that the hourly rate may be used by previous arrangement with the passengers after the meter has registered an amount equal to that of the first hour, conforming to the rates as herein provided for. No other methods of figuring rates or measuring distances shall be allowed. 
(C)  No person shall operate or drive any taxicab equipped with a taximeter, in public service, with the case of the taximeter not sealed and the cover and gear thereof not intact. 
(D)  No person shall operate or drive a taxicab after sundown without having the face of the taximeter thereon illuminated as hereinafter provided, or drive a taxicab without having the taximeter set and regulated to conform with the rates of fare in § 115.48. 
(E)  All taximeters and the power take-off gearbox shall be sealed by the Dayton Police Department and must at all times bear this seal when operating. Every such meter and gearbox shall be inspected by the Dayton Police Department at least twice each year and at other periodic intervals. 
(F)  It shall be the responsibility of both, the taxicab operator and the taxicab independent operator and/or driver to ascertain that the meter and gearbox are sealed before driving any taxicab within the city. 
(G)  Every taximeter shall be equipped with a suitable light and properly placed for readability from any rear seat location. 
(H)  Taxicab operators shall present to the Police Department, when requested, the certificate of the manufacturer or lessor of such taximeters that each taximeter in use is in good working order and that it does accurately indicate the fare due to be paid upon the distance traveled and the waiting time, in a manner not to exceed the maximum rates of fare prescribed in § 115.48. 
(Ord. 27414, passed 6-25-86; Am. Ord. 31362-14, passed 12-31-14) 
Cross reference- Penalty, see § 115.99. 
Sec. 115.48. - Rates of fare. 
(A)  It is unlawful for any taxicab operator or independent operator and/or driver to charge a fare for taxicab services in excess of the following: 
(1)  Four dollars for the first one-half mile, and $0.23 for each additional one-tenth mile for a single passenger. 
(2)  Twenty-three cents for each additional one-tenth mile per trip for each additional passenger. 
(3)  No charge for children under the age of six when accompanied by a paying fare. 
(4)  No charge for two pieces of hand luggage per passenger. 
(5)  Ten cents for each piece of hand luggage, in excess of two per passenger, which must be handled by the driver. 
(6)  Fifteen dollars for each hour of waiting time, which amount may be prorated at the option of the taxicab operator. 
(B)  Notwithstanding § 115.48(A), a taxicab operator or independent operator and/or driver may charge a minimum fare of $5.00 for taxicab services provided within the city. A taxicab operator or independent operator and/or driver may only charge a minimum fee of $5.00 when the total fare collected in accordance with § 115.48(A) is less than $5.00. 
(C)  No taxicab operator or independent operator and/or driver shall use, or permit the use of, a defective or inaccurate taximeter, or a taximeter which charges an amount in excess of the fare permitted by this section.
